commit message: + set index.html as per default welcome page url
+ add the search index compilation to the globale Makefil
conf files: generic values for mickeygen
translation of docroot/error.html fa to simple
fixed include lang common on es
added crawlers for some sub-projects in es
FIXED: bug in protocol preventing access to last article in an index
U.I changes: search field size + fixed label align
gecko 1.9 ready nsMoulin + docroot creator script
hack against crash on huge math import
fixed html for rtl+gecko1.9 and layout for 800x600 and home icon and rtl back/fwd buttons
added FF2-like find in page box
added french localization for win32 autorun
added support for indexing on multiple instances/machines
added support for uncompression on install
adding moulin maker script (temp replacement for Makefile)
fixes on findbar + capitalize first letter compo
new style for sidebar / bookmarks behavior change
fixed css for external link on ltr

Fixed a segfault when word map was empty and create a .index
file with the word map size ( == 0)

Sanity check in word completion: if there's no map, don't
try to access it.

rootPath is a global variable... declaring it as a local one
prevent initialization of the global one.

Adding Zeno component, based on Kiwix component, and
Zeno protocol handler, based on Moulin protocol handler.
I haven't commited the build/Makefile and components/Makefile
as there's much chance Zeno component won't compile for now.
(libzeno.a and libcxxtools.a are (for now) only found if
installed in /usr/local/lib and zeno/*.h files must be in
default include path)

Updated component Makefiles so they're using pkg-config if
available and moved LD_FLAGS at the right place, so compilation
with a 1.9 sdk produce working binaries.
Fixed a possible memory leak in zeno component (still not sure
if I should free memory when using a nsDependentString though)
Fixed a focus problem with completion popup when using 1.9 sdk
Updated application maxVersion...

IWikiComponent.h is a generated files, it shouldn't be in
the repository.

Removed the useless and cumbersome build/moulin and build/kiwix
directories and updated build/Makefile so directories are created
if not existing. Removed the '.svn' cleanup part too as it's now
useless.

Added decoding of %20, %28 and %29 to ' ', '(' and ')'.
I shouldn't have to do this... iso-8859 encoded zeno
files shoudn't even exists :/

Not sure why the autotools cache and the configure log
were on the repository.

Kiwix indexer is now able to parse .zeno files and output
.index and .map used by kiwix to search through articles.

now reports 'file not found' for empty files... not sure
why I need to do that, but it was behaving weirdly without it

Added 'corpus manager': now kiwix can handle multiple data
source, each source should be in a different directory
with .index and .map files in it.
Finally added zenocomponent to build scripts.

Commited the wrong Makefile.real.in and forgot to rename
the xml corpora file to something better.
+ take a look for the zenolib in the /extern/zeno directory

Added detection of zenolib in extern dir as a fallback when
it's not detected at the system scope.
It seems that xpidl is not in 'bin' dir on Fedora Linux.

Updated Kiwix to use last libzeno.
Updated autotools scripts in indexer/kiwix to fix
compilation issues.
Removed iso -> utf8 conversion code in zeno component.
Updated components build scripts so they should be
working on more environment now.

The corpus manager is now able to retrieve a list of corpus
from an url and to 'install' those corpus.

Downloaded corpus are now saved to something better...
Corpus home is now URI encoded and decoded when needed to.

configure.ac no longer exist.
It has been moved to configure_orig.ac
Another script (configure_alt.ac) has been added.
autogen.sh now creates a symlink to the appropriate configure.ac.
By default, it uses the _orig one.
launch autogen.sh alt to use the new one or autogen.sh orig to restore the default one.
Please DO NOT add configure.ac back to subversion repo.

replace AS_STRING_HELP by AC_STRING_HELP although this one is deprecated. Reason is that the MozillaBuildPackage has autoconf2.56 and that AS_STRING_HELP was introduced in autoconf2.58. As this 'deprecated' usage has no impact (neither warning nor error) it is better to use the old form of the macro instead of the 'new' one.
